comments:
I've been using the 0215 build of AJDT in incremental mode to develop my
project. (The 0217 build always resorts to a full build, even in incremental
mode.) Unfortunately, about 50% of the time, an incremental build triggers a
NullPointerException dialog with no further information. An examination of the
ErrorLog view in Eclipse reveals no details. This NPE seems to leave the built
system in an inconsistent state. A full build is required to restore it to
runnability. I wish I could report more, but the NPE seems to happen randomly
and I can't find a stack trace to submit.
I just checked the 02 21 build. This bug still exists.

Hi Nick,
The next time this happens, please could you look carefully at the dialog - is
the title "AspectJ Error", and the message "NullPointerException thrown: null"?
Also please look at the Problems view, and see if you have an entry beginning
"Internal compiler error". If so right-click properties should get a stack trace
(all on one line). This might be the same, or similar, to bug 87376.

I always get the message you describe, but I get a stack trace as you describe
one time in 200 errors, I was lucky enough to get one today. I hope it helps!

Internal compiler error
java.lang.NullPointerException

	at
org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.compiler.lookup.EclipseFactory.makeResolvedMember(EclipseFactory.java:224)

	at
org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AsmHierarchyBuilder.getPointcutDeclaration(AsmHierarchyBuilder.java:384)

	at

	at

	at
org.aspectj.org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.MethodDeclaration.traverse(MethodDeclaration.java:167)

	at
org.aspectj.org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.ast.TypeDeclaration.traverse(TypeDeclaration.java:1133)

	at

	at

	at

	at
org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.compiler.lookup.EclipseFactory.finishedCompilationUnit(EclipseFactory.java:354)

	at

	at

	at

	at

	at
org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.core.builder.AjBuildManager.incrementalBuild(AjBuildManager.java:109)

	at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.compile(CompilerAdapter.java:117)

org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run(AspectJBuildManager.java:165)

Yes, that helps a lot. The stack is the same as compiler bug 87376, which is
easily reproducible from the command line with a small testcase. So I'm going to
mark this one as a dup., although of course there may be another bug that you're
hitting as well - please open a new report if you still get a problem after
87376 has been fixed, or if you get a different stack trace.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 87376 ***
